subject: Olympic Games
World War II (1939-45)
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: On Aug. 4, 1936, John Woodruff, boxed in by other runners in the 800-meter final in Berlin, stopped in his tracks, let everyone go by, then passed them all to win the gold.
snippet: On Aug. 4, 1936, John Woodruff, boxed in by other runners in the 800-meter final in Berlin, stopped in his tracks, let everyone go by, then passed them all to win the gold.
